intro: Sphaerocionium nigricans, commonly known as the blackstem spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its dark green, somewhat succulent leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. Its stems are typically woody and can become quite branched over time. Sphaerocionium nigricans is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
